Hi Dave


I did have some troubles with cantera installing under my linux x=
86_64
machine and now I soved it (partially). The distribution is a Suse 10=
.0.

After compilation with 'make' command and instalation with "make
insta=
ll" the follow message is shown in the console:

 #########################=
#############################################
    Warning: the Cantera Pyth=
on package is not installed. If you
    intentionally skipped it, ignore th=
is message. Otherwise, type
    'make python' and/or 'make python-install' =
and look for error
messages.
    Note that you must first install the 'numa=
rray' package before
installing
    the Cantera package.
 #################=
#####################################################
          


I did 'm=
ake python' and 'make python-install' but not any error was
given. Otherwis=
e during temptative to run any python example or tool
(mixmaster) error mes=
sages anoucing there aren't python libraries. I
compared with my cantera 32=
 bits instalation ad I found out that the
PYTHONPATH enviroment variable ha=
d a litle mistake. The right setup
for x86_64 machines of PYTHONPATH variab=
le is
$prefix/lib64/python2.4/site-packages in place of
$prefix/lib/python2=
.4/site-packages. I would like to give my
contribution indicating where nee=
d change the finish_install.py file
but I have not enought knowledgement in=
 python language to suggest the
right replacements. I changed the setup_can=
tera file and now cantera
python  codes are working fine.

Please, could so=
mebody help us with the right code for instalation in
x86_64 machines?


Ma=
ny Tanks in advance

Wladimyr
